intro: Acmella glaberrima, commonly known as the yellow marsh mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in wetland areas and has hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, smooth seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in wetland gardens.
